org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.qptl

Class QPTLQuantification

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.Logic
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.qptl.QPTL
        • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.qptl.QPTLQuantification
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, NegationNormalForm<QPTL>, PrenexNormalForm<QPTL>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QPTLExists, QPTLForall

    public abstract class QPTLQuantification
extends QPTL
    This class represents QPTL formulae with an out-most quantifier.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Returns true if some larger formula containing this formula is in prenex normal form.
      boolean isPromising()
      Returns true if this formula is a promising formula, which is p U q, <> p, ~ [] ~p, ~(p W q), or ~(p R q).
      boolean isPureFuture()
      Returns true if this formula contains only future operators.
      boolean isPurePast()
      Returns true if this formula contains only past operators.

      • getNegationNormalForm

        public QPTL getNegationNormalForm(DualMode mode)
        Description copied from class: QPTL
        Returns the QPTL formula in negation normal form (NNF). The dual of an until formula or a since formula depends on the dual mode.
        Specified by:
        getNegationNormalForm in class QPTL
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the QPTL formula in negation normal form

      • getPrenexNormalForm2

        protected QPTL getPrenexNormalForm2(DualMode mode)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: QPTL
        A helper method for #getPrenexNormalForm(DualMode). Before invoking this method, the bound variables are already renamed such that there is no variable bound at difference places. For example, before invoking method on the formula "(E t, [](t --> y)) ∧ (E : t, [] (t --> x))", the second bound t will be renamed.
        Specified by:
        getPrenexNormalForm2 in class QPTL
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode of duality of temporal operators
        Returns:
        this formula in prenex normal form
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this formula cannot be converted into prenex normal form

      • hasBoundVariable

        public boolean hasBoundVariable(Proposition x)
        Description copied from class: QPTL
        Returns true if a specified proposition is bound (quantified) in this formula. For example, "t ∧ E : t, [] (t --> x)" has a quantified variable t.
        Specified by:
        hasBoundVariable in class QPTL
        Parameters:
        x - a proposition
        Returns:
        true if x is bound in this formula

      • hasFreeVariable

        public boolean hasFreeVariable(Proposition x)
        Description copied from class: QPTL
        Returns true if a specified proposition occurs freely (not quantified) in this formula. For example, "t ∧ E : t, [] (t --> x)" has two free variables t and x.
        Specified by:
        hasFreeVariable in class QPTL
        Parameters:
        x - a proposition
        Returns:
        true if x is free in this formula

      • newInstance

        public QPTLQuantification newInstance(Proposition q,
                                      QPTL f)
        Creates a new instance of QPTLQuantfication by applying the quantifier of this formula to a specified formula over a specified proposition.
        Parameters:
        q - a proposition to be quantified
        f - a formula with q to be quantified
        Returns:
        a QPTL formula obtained by applying the quantifier of this formula to f over q

      • dual

        public abstract QPTLQuantification dual(Proposition q,
                                        QPTL f)
        Returns a quantified formula where the quantification is the dual of the quantification in this formula.
        Parameters:
        q - the quantified proposition of the returned formula
        f - the sub-formula of the returned formula
        Returns:
        a quantified formula where the quantification is the dual of the quantification in this formula, the quantified proposition if q, and the sub-formula is f

      • renameBoundVariables

        protected QPTL renameBoundVariables(java.util.Collection<Proposition> seen)
        Description copied from class: QPTL
        Renames bound variables with the information of bound variables already seen such that there is no variable bound at difference places.
        Specified by:
        renameBoundVariables in class QPTL
        Parameters:
        seen - a set of bound variables already seen
        Returns:
        a QPTL formula obtained from this formula by renaming bound propositions to different names

      • replace

        public QPTL replace(java.util.Map<Proposition,QPTL> subst)
        Description copied from class: QPTL
